greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of Otter's asymptotic constant beta for the number of rooted trees.
reference: S. R. Finch, Mathematical Constants, Cambridge, 2003, Section 5.6., p.296
D. E. Knuth, Fundamental Algorithms, 3d Ed. 1997, p. 396.
link: Vaclav Kotesovec, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1799, (this constant was computed by David Broadhurst in November 1999)
mathematica: digits = 87; max = 250; s[n_, k_] := s[n, k] = a[n+1-k] + If[n < 2*k, 0, s[n-k, k]]; a[1] = 1; a[n_] := a[n] = Sum[a[k]*s[n-1, k]*k, {k, 1, n-1}]/(n-1); A[x_] := Sum[a[k]*x^k, {k, 0, max}]; APrime[x_] := Sum[k*a[k]*x^(k-1), {k, 0, max}]; eq = Log[c] == 1 + Sum[A[c^(-k)]/k, {k, 2, max}]; alpha = c /. FindRoot[eq, {c, 3}, WorkingPrecision -> digits+5]; b = Sqrt[(1 + Sum[APrime[alpha^-k]/alpha^k, {k, 2, max}])/(2*Pi)]; RealDigits[b, 10, digits] // First (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Sep 24 2014 *)
results.author: _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jan 04 2013
